q_a.a: Hover over "Stats" for how they work. What stats are important depend on what actions you need that uses them.
Short runs are better, for the early game and current balance. But as your runs get longer and you accrue talent and soulstones, longer runs become more useful.

q_a.q: What should my first goal be?
q_a.a: Finish the Crystal quest for mana, then do any other ones.

time_controls.restart_text: Resets the loop. Not a hard reset.

stories.story: Wrong place and wrong time. You were visiting the village next to yours, looking for work, when monsters attacked! Wolves, trolls, ogres, even a chimera destroyed the town while you were hiding under cover. When your cover was destroyed by a stray fireball from the defenders, you ran out in the open - just in time for a platinum adventurer to conjure an elemental, right underneath you. You blacked out, and when you came to, the monsters were all defeated, and cleanup was underway. You helped for a bit, but then you suddenly collapsed - painlessly, thankfully - and the world went dark. You woke up, and you were back where you were, minutes ago! You were looping in time! Desperately, you tried to run, but in about the same time, it happened again. A few more loops, and you accidentally ran into a vase with water in it - and then the loop lasted just a little longer. After some experimentation, it seems that your mana is your clock, and when it runs out - time resets. Hopefully there's enough mana around you to get enough time to do something meaningful. For now, you need to search for more mana water, and figure out how to use it better.

tooltip.explanation:
Each stat level reduces the relevant part of an action's mana cost by 1%.
Talent exp gain is equal to 1% of stat exp gain, and persists through loops.
Talent multiplies xp gain by (1+(talentLevel)^0.4/3).
XP gain towards a stat per action is (original mana / actual mana) * (talent bonus) per tick.
Total Mult is a combination of your talent and soulstone bonuses.

e.g. Meet People costs 800 mana and has a breakdown of
Int
10%
Cha
80%
Soul
10%.
This effectively means 80 of the mana is controlled by
Int
, another 80 by
Soul
, and the remaining 640 by
Cha
.
If your
Cha
is level 20 when the action is started, the bonus would be x1.2 so it'd be 640 / 1.2 = 533.33
Adding back the 160 from
Soul
and
Int
, the total mana the action takes (rounded up) is now 694, so ~87% of the original mana cost.
The action would give (800/694)*(1+(talent)^0.4/3) level exp per mana for the 694 mana.

manasense.label: Mana Sense
manasense.desc: To control mana, first you need to know how to feel it around you.

manacontrol.label: Mana Control
manacontrol.desc: Control the mana to affect the world in mystical ways. Useful for both mana coming in or going out.

weapons.label: Weapons
weapons.desc: Your ability to use weapons for fighting one on one, or long range.

dark_ritual.label: Dark Ritual
dark_ritual.desc: The witch appreciates your dedication to the dark arts. +1% to Dark Magic exp gain from the Dark Magic action (rounded down) per ritual.
dark_ritual.desc2:
Actions are 10% faster in Beginnersville per ritual from 1-20.
Actions are 5% faster in the Forest Path per ritual from 21-40.
Actions are 2.5% faster in Merchanton per ritual from 41-60.

town0.desc: Recently shattered by a monster wave, it's got tons of things to fix.

town1.name: Deep Well
town1.desc: You felt something big in here. It's time to find it.

tooltip.desc:
Mana cost is based on ratio of stat %s.
Gained exp is proportional too.
Stat/Talent exp is gained every tick.
Skill exp is gained upon action completion unless otherwise specified.
Actions will target unchecked objects before known lootable objects.
tooltip.mana_used_explanation:
Shows stat gain affecting speed.
Updates every completed action.
Accurate at end of run.
tooltip.add_action_top: Add action to top of list
tooltip.higher_done_percent_benefic: You can find more stuff with higher %.
tooltip.list_explanation:
Drag and drop the actions to re-arrange them.
The next list becomes the current list every restart.
One second = 50 mana.
Minimum 1 tick per action.
Restarts automatically upon no actions left.

sense_potions.label: Sense Potions
sense_potions.tooltip: You need mana immediately, to keep going. You're not proud of this, but you'll be searching through mana potions that the town's defenders... left behind. Straining your ability to sense mana starts to pay off... permanently. Becomes 100% more effective for each mana sense level.
sense_potions.story_1: 50% Checked:⮀ You've found all of the easy potions. You can tell there are some under rubble, but your Mana Sense skill has to be a bit higher to find them.
sense_potions.story_2: 100% Checked:⮀ You've checked everywhere, and all of the available potions in town are known to you.

drink_potion.label: Drink Potion
drink_potion.tooltip: Some of them have mana left, sometimes the mana sense is pinging off of a different potion. No choice but to drink it to figure it out.
drink_potion.tooltip2: Each good potion gives 150 mana. Every 10 potions are good. You can choose to drink the good ones first with "lootable first" checked.

dive_into_well.label: Dive Into Well
dive_into_well.tooltip:
While searching for mana potions, you felt something much bigger, although further away. After searching all around town, you've found the strongest source - down the well. You don't have much time, so you dive in to figure out what's down there.
Unlocked when Mana Sense is at least 3.

sense_crystals.label: Sense Crystals
sense_crystals.tooltip: You can feel mana crystals around you. They're in rubble and dirt piles, shaken loose from the battles that were fought above. Becomes 100% more effective for each mana sense level.
sense_crystals.story_1: 50% Checked:⮀ You've found most of the mana crystals.
sense_crystals.story_2: 100% Checked:⮀ You've checked everywhere, and all of the available crystals in the well are known to you.

uncover_crystal.label: Uncover Crystal
uncover_crystal.tooltip: Luckily, there is an shovel nearby. You work to remove the covering dirt, and reveal crystals with fresh mana in them.
uncover_crystal.tooltip2: Each good crystal gives 600-800 mana. Every 2 crystals are good. You can choose to drink the good ones first with "lootable first" checked. Every Mana Control level increases mana the crystal gives by 10, until they give 800.
uncover_crystal.story_1: 5 Crystals with mana:⮀ You're steadily improving the mana you can get from these crystals, but you've taken from all that have mana.
uncover_crystal.story_2: Mana Control 20:⮀ Every bit of mana from the crystals is pulled out when you try.
